content.title: The Post-Matric Scholarship For Scheduled Tribes Students
content.details: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to students belonging to Scheduled Tribes pursuing Post-Matriculation recognized courses in recognized institutions. The scheme covers professional/technical as well as non-professional and non-technical courses at various levels and also correspondence courses including distance and continuing education. The scheme is 90:10 funding from by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs and Mizoram state.
benefits: Financial assistance to pursue post-matriculation studies.
Encourages ST students to continue their education beyond the matriculation level.
Increased literacy rate among ST communities.
Empowerment of ST students to become self-reliant.
Reduction of dropouts among ST students.
eligibility: Parents/Guardians’ income from all sources should not exceed Rs. 2,50,000/- per annum.
Candidates must belong to Scheduled Tribes.
Studying Class XI up to Post-Doctoral Fellowship.
content.application_process: Online. Open the official website of NSP, register if not already registered, login, click on the 'POST-MATRIC SCHOLARSHIP FOR SCHEDULED TRIBES STUDENTS' option, fill out the application form, upload required documents, and submit the application.
documents_required: Income certificate issued by competent authority (up to date)

faqs.question: What are the benefits of Post-Matric Scholarship for Scheduled Tribes Students?
faqs.answer: The Post-Matric Scholarship for Scheduled Tribes Students is a government scholarship scheme that provides financial assistance to ST students to pursue post-matriculation studies.

faqs.question: What expenses are covered under the scholarship?
faqs.answer: The scholarship covers the expenses of tuition fees, maintenance fees, and other incidental expenses such as books and stationery.

faqs.question: How much scholarship amount is provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scholarship amount varies from state to state, but in general, it covers the expenses of tuition fees, maintenance fees, and other incidental expenses such as books and stationery.

faqs.question: Is the scholarship renewable?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scholarship is renewable, subject to the academic performance of the student and the availability of funds.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the scholarship?
faqs.answer: The duration of the scholarship is for the entire course, subject to satisfactory academic performance and the availability of funds.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: ST students who have passed matriculation or higher secondary examination and are pursuing post-matriculation studies in any recognized institution are eligible for the scholarship.

faqs.question: Is there any income limit for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is an income limit for the scholarship. The exact limit varies from state to state, but in general, the annual family income of the applicant should not exceed a certain amount.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: Through online in Mizoram Scholarship Board Portal or NSP.

faqs.question: What documents are required to apply for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: The documents required to apply for the scholarship include caste certificate, income certificate, mark sheet of the previous examination, and bank account details.

faqs.question: What is the selection process for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: The selection process for the scholarship is based on the merit of the applicant and the availability of funds.
